line: question asked him by any of the senators, but they

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.
speaker: Third Servingman
line: stand bald before him: our general himself makes a

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.
speaker: Third Servingman
line: mistress of him: sanctifies himself with's hand and

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.
speaker: Third Servingman
line: turns up the white o' the eye to his discourse. But

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.
speaker: Third Servingman
line: the bottom of the news is that our general is cut i'

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.
speaker: Third Servingman
line: the middle and but one half of what he was

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.
speaker: Third Servingman
line: yesterday; for the other has half, by the entreaty

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.
speaker: Third Servingman
line: and grant of the whole table. He'll go, he says,

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.
speaker: Third Servingman
line: and sowl the porter of Rome gates by the ears: he

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.
speaker: Third Servingman
line: Do't! he will do't; for, look you, sir, he has as

speaker: Third Servingman
line: many friends as enemies; which friends, sir, as it

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.

line: were, durst not, look you, sir, show themselves, as

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.
speaker: Third Servingman
line: we term it, his friends whilst he's in directitude.

line: Directitude! what's that?

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.
speaker: Third Servingman

line: and the man in blood, they will out of their

speaker: Third Servingman

speaker: Third Servingman
line: him.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.

line: Why, then we shall have a stirring world again.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.
speaker: Second Servingman
line: great maker of cuckolds.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.

line: Reason; because they then less need one another.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.

line: as Volscians. They are rising, they are rising.

speaker: BRUTUS
line: Caius Marcius was

speaker: CORIOLANUS
line: Stain all your edges on me. Boy! false hound!

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: CORIOLANUS
line: If you have writ your annals true, 'tis there,

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: CORIOLANUS
line: That, like an eagle in a dove-cote, I

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: CORIOLANUS
line: Flutter'd your Volscians in Corioli:

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: CORIOLANUS
line: Alone I did it. Boy!

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: AUFIDIUS
line: Why, noble lords,

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: AUFIDIUS
line: Will you be put in mind of his blind fortune,

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: AUFIDIUS
line: Which was your shame, by this unholy braggart,

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: AUFIDIUS
line: 'Fore your own eyes and ears?

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: All Conspirators
line: Let him die for't.

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: All The People
line: 'Tear him to pieces.' 'Do it presently.' 'He kill'd

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: All The People
line: my son.' 'My daughter.' 'He killed my cousin

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: All The People
line: Marcus.' 'He killed my father.'

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Peace, ho! no outrage: peace!

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: Second Lord
line: The man is noble and his fame folds-in

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: Second Lord
line: This orb o' the earth. His last offences to us

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Shall have judicious hearing. Stand, Aufidius,

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: Second Lord
line: And trouble not the peace.

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: CORIOLANUS
line: O that I had him,

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: CORIOLANUS
line: With six Aufidiuses, or more, his tribe,

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: CORIOLANUS
line: To use my lawful sword!

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: AUFIDIUS
line: Insolent villain!

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: All Conspirators
line: Kill, kill, kill, kill, kill him!

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: Lords
line: Hold, hold, hold, hold!

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: AUFIDIUS
line: My noble masters, hear me speak.

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: First Lord
line: O Tullus,--

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Thou hast done a deed whereat valour will weep.

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: Third Lord
line: Tread not upon him. Masters all, be quiet;

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: Third Lord
line: Put up your swords.

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: AUFIDIUS
line: My lords, when you shall know--as in this rage,

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: AUFIDIUS
line: Provoked by him, you cannot--the great danger

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: AUFIDIUS
line: Which this man's life did owe you, you'll rejoice

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: AUFIDIUS
line: That he is thus cut off. Please it your honours

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: AUFIDIUS
line: To call me to your senate, I'll deliver

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: AUFIDIUS
line: Myself your loyal servant, or endure

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: AUFIDIUS
line: Your heaviest censure.

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: First Lord
line: Bear from hence his body;

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: First Lord
line: And mourn you for him: let him be regarded

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: First Lord
line: As the most noble corse that ever herald

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: First Lord
line: Did follow to his urn.

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: Second Lord
line: His own impatience

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Takes from Aufidius a great part of blame.

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Let's make the best of it.

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: AUFIDIUS
line: My rage is gone;

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: AUFIDIUS
line: And I am struck with sorrow. Take him up.

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: AUFIDIUS
line: Help, three o' the chiefest soldiers; I'll be one.

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: AUFIDIUS
line: Beat thou the drum, that it speak mournfully:

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: AUFIDIUS
line: Trail your steel pikes. Though in this city he

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: AUFIDIUS
line: Hath widow'd and unchilded many a one,

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: AUFIDIUS
line: Which to this hour bewail the injury,

scene: SCENE VI.  Antium. A public place.
speaker: AUFIDIUS
line: Yet he shall have a noble memory. Assist.
